subject: AI
title: Defining AI Product KPIs
description: Metrics that tell you if your AI feature is working.

hook.text: The AI feature has 10,000 daily queries. Is that good? Without KPIs, you can't tell if users love it or just don't have an alternative.

buildup.text: AI product KPIs: adoption rate (what % of eligible users try it?), retention (do they come back?), task completion (do they finish what they started?), and satisfaction (thumbs up ratio).

discovery.text: The most important KPI is the one that measures your product's core promise. If the AI helps users find answers, track 'time to answer.' If it generates content, track 'content published.'

twist.text: Usage â‰  value. Users might use the AI chatbot a lot because it gives confusing answers that require multiple attempts. High usage + low satisfaction = a bad sign.

climax.text: Pick 2â€“3 KPIs that reflect actual value delivered. Track them weekly. If they trend down, the feature needs work â€” regardless of how cool the technology is.

punchline.text: Usage measures curiosity. Retention measures value. Track what matters.

quiz.question: Why is high usage alone not a good KPI for an AI feature?
options: High usage always means high value
Users might interact frequently because the AI gives confusing answers requiring retries
KPIs aren't needed for AI features
